file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 31-33-01-04 - EQAR DISK - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EQAR DISK - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH EQAR 1. General A. This section gives the procedures: • to remove the recorded data disk from the EQAR. • to install the disk to be recorded in the EQAR. B. The EQAR is installed in the rear electronic compartment. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY EQAR RECORDED DATA DISK - REMOV- AIRCRAFT WITH EQAR 31-33-01-000-801-A AL AIRCRAFT WITH EQAR 31-33-01-400-801-A EQAR DATA DISK - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 31-33-01 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 31-33-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH EQAR 2. EQAR RECORDED DATA DISK - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the recorded data disk from the EQAR. (2) The EQAR is installed in the rear electronic compartment. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272DR Fuselage rear section I - right side D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Remove the recorded disk Rear electronic compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Energize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (2) Open door 272DR (Rear Electronic Compartment). J. Disk Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Make sure that the EQAR is powered on. (2) Open the EQAR front door EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 31-33-01 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Momentarily push the EJECT pushbutton and wait for the disk to eject. (4) Place the disk in a protective box. (5) Close the EQAR front door. (6) Send the disk to the analysis department. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close door 272DR. (2) Deenergize the aircraft. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 31-33-01 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH EQAR EQAR Recorded Data Disk - Removal/Installation Figure 401 DOOR 272DR A ZONE 272 C B DET. A INSERT DISK ON ONE WAY ONLY DISK LOW STATUS PRESS BUTTON TO EJECT (WAIT FEW SEC.) CAUTION: DISK MUST BE LOCK RECORDABLE LABEL DET. B EQAR FRONT PANEL 145AMM310159.MCE DET. C EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 31-33-01 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 31-33-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH EQAR 3. EQAR DATA DISK - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the disk to be recorded into the EQAR. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272DR Rear electronic compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Install the disk Rear electronic compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Energize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (2) On the circuit breaker panel, make sure that the QAR circuit breaker is closed. (3) Open door 272DR (Rear Electronic Compartment). J. Disk Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Make sure that the green "ON" LED is on. (2) NOTE: If no disk is in the recorder, the STATUS LED comes on a few seconds after the power is on. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 31-33-01 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL Open the EQAR front door. (3) Remove a previously formatted optical disk from its protective box. (4) NOTE: If a disk was installed, it may have flight data recorded. Send the disk to the analysis department. Make sure that the write enable Tab is set at the enabled position before you put the new recording disk into the EQAR. (5) NOTE: See the label at the backside of the door. It shows you how to insert the disk. If it is not in the correct position and alignment, the disk interlock will prevent the full insertion of the disk. DO NOT FORCE IT. With your finger tip, PUSH in fully until the disk locks. The disk must stay in place. (6) Make sure that the STATUS LED is off. (7) Close the EQAR front door. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Close door 272DR (Rear Electronic Compartment). (2) Deenergize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 31-33-01 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
